Html:
Hi!

In VB.Net I'm using 

ExcelApplication.Run("TestMacro")

to run some macro.

However, is it possible to check in advance, if this macro exists or not?

I can only think of Try / Catch Exception... is there a better solution?

Thanks,
Daniel

hello,

is your macro defined in a VBA code modul or in Excel-DNA?

for VBA:

http://www.cpearson.com/excel/vbe.aspx

you can modify the Listing All Modules In A Project and Listing All Procedures In A Module tutorials.

Sebastian

Hi Sebastian

Thank you for the quick answer! It works perfectly fine!

Daniel
